page.title: 16RELIGION IN STOCKTON.
page.content: THE CHURCH OF ST. CHADS STANDS ON A SLIGHT RISE SOUTH OF THE VILLAGE.IT IS AN ANCIENT BUILDING OF RED SANDSTONE IN THE DECORATED STYLE,WITH SOME EARLY NORMAN WORK ,CONSISTING OF A CHANCEL,NAVE,SHORT TRANSCEPTS & AN EMBATTLED WESTERN TOWER WITH PINNACLES, CONTAINING A CLOCK A 6 BELLS.THE CHURCH WAS REMODELLED IN THE MID 17TH CENTURY AND RESTORED IN 1858-6O WHEN THE WHOLE OF THE CHANCEL WAS REFACED WITH BATH STONE. THE PARISH REGISTER DATES FROM 1558. A GRANITE CROSS IN THE CHURCHYRAD IS IN MEMORY OF THE 16 MEN WHO DIED IN THE FIRST WORLD WAR. THE LIVING WAS ONCE A RECTORY PLUS 2O ACRES OF GLEBE, A GIFT OF APLEY ESTATE. IN 1975 THE RESIDENT PRIEST DIED AND A GROUP MINISTRY WAS ESTABLISHED WHEREBY 1 RECTOR NOW LOOKS AFTER 3 NEIGHBOURING PARISHES.THE REVEREND A. MELLY IS THE INCUMBENT.
